labels.analysis: The Deep Dive MCP Server functions as a flexible platform for integrating tools and resources via the Model Context Protocol, specifically designed to enhance LLM applications. Its primary focus appears to be enabling dynamic tool integration, particularly around weather-related tasks, as evidenced by the two available tools. The server supports deployment in containerized environments and integrates with Claude Desktop, suggesting a development or productivity enhancement use case.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality revolves around tool integration and protocol implementation, which aligns with API integration capabilities. Secondary labels of Weather and Daily Productivity were chosen based on the available tools and potential use cases for personal productivity. No custom label was needed as the predefined categories adequately cover the functionality.

tools.description: Get weather forecast for a location

server_info_crawled.name: Deep Dive MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @flynnhou/deep-dive-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide a customizable MCP server implementation that integrates with Claude Desktop and other clients. Enable dynamic loading and execution of tools and resources via the Model Context Protocol to enhance LLM applications. Simplify installation and deployment with support for Smithery and containerized environments.

tools.name: get-alerts
tools.description: Get weather alerts for a state

tools.name: get-forecast
tools.description: Get weather forecast for a location

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@flynnhou/deep-dive-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
